metadata.Title: CVE-2011-1290 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in WebKit, as used on the Research In Motion (RIM) BlackBerry Torch 9800 with firmware 6.0.0.246, in Google Chrome before 10.0.648.133, and in Apple Safari before 5.0.5, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via unknown vectors related to CSS "style handling," nodesets, and a length value, as demonstrated by Vincenzo Iozzo, Willem Pinckaers, and Ralf-Philipp Weinmann during a Pwn2Own competition at CanSecWest 2011.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-1290` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 10.0.648.133~r77742-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 10.0.648.133~r77742-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 10.0.648.133~r77742-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 10.0.648.133~r77742-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 10.0.648.133~r77742-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
gir1.2-webkit-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
gir1.2-webkit2-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-bin - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkit2gtk-3.0-25 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-1.0-common - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-3.0-common - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> qt4-x11 unmaintained upstream (see README.webkit for details)

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.0.648.133~r77742-0ubuntu1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
webkitgtk package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.9-2ubuntu2').
